title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Va Tech Wabag secures ₹46.5 crore solar project order
items.summary:
*Va Tech Wabag* has secured a ₹46.5 crore order to deliver water management solutions for *RenewSys's* new 2 GW *solar cell* manufacturing plant in *Hyderabad*.
- The project includes design, engineering, and installation of *ultrapure water*, *effluent treatment*, and *zero liquid discharge* systems, completing in 11 months.
- This move aligns with Wabag's strategy to expand into high-growth sectors like *solar*, *green hydrogen*, and *semiconductors*, strengthening its industrial portfolio.

items.title: Foxconn Pulls 300 Chinese Engineers from India
items.summary:
- *Foxconn* has asked its subsidiary Yuzhan Technology to send back around *300 Chinese engineers* from its India facility.
- This move occurs amid a regional *diplomatic reset* between India and China, and following previous recalls of engineers.
- Despite these disruptions, *companies* have prepared *contingency plans* to mitigate impact, such as sourcing engineers from Taiwan and other countries.

**Key points highlight the geopolitical influence on supply chains, with ongoing diplomatic improvements between India and China.**

items.title: Karam Safety acquires 90% stake in Brazil’s Alteco
items.summary: *Karam Safety*, part of *KS Group*, has acquired a 90% stake in *Alteco*, a Brazil-based company specializing in *height safety*. // This move is part of *KS Group’s* expansion strategy in *Latin America*, leveraging *Alteco’s* local manufacturing capacity. // Both companies anticipate improvements in *product development*, *logistics*, and *customer service* during integration to support growth in *Brazil* and across the region.

items.title: Foxconn appoints new leaders in India and globally
items.summary:
- *V Lee* has been promoted to a **global role** in Foxconn for business development, after leading Foxconn India for over four years.
- *Robert Wu*, previously CEO of Sharp in Japan, is now the new **country head** in India, taking over during a period of industry uncertainty due to **US tariffs** and **China restrictions**.
- Under Lee, Foxconn India’s business exceeded **$20 billion**, with nearly **80,000 employees**, highlighting the company's growth and strategic restructuring amid global challenges.

items.title: Trump considers repurposing $2B from CHIPS Act
items.summary:
- The Trump administration is contemplating reallocating *$2 billion* from the *CHIPS Act* to fund *critical minerals* projects, aiming to reduce *U.S. dependence on China*.  
- This move would centralize control over mineral funding under *Commerce Secretary Lutnick*, potentially involving grants or equity stakes in mining companies.  
- The strategy aligns with national security goals, as critical minerals are vital for electronics and defense, with U.S. companies like Albemarle calling for government support.

items.title: Kyndryl to Invest $2.25B in India for AI & Talent
items.summary:
- *Kyndryl*, a US IT firm spun out of IBM, announced a **$2.25 billion** investment in India over three years.
- The plan includes creating an **AI Innovation Lab** in Bengaluru, developing local talent, and supporting **digital training** for 200,000 citizens.
- The company aims to align with India's *IndiaAI Mission*, enhance its services, and foster **regional innovation ecosystems** across tier-2 and tier-3 cities.

items.title: India reduced carbon intensity by 7% between FY14-24
items.summary:
• *India* decreased its *carbon intensity* by **7%** from FY14 to FY24, mainly due to increased *renewable energy* share.  
• The country achieved its *50%* non-fossil fuel capacity target **5 years early**, with 50.25% as of July 2025.  
• The government promotes *clean energy* initiatives like FDI, Renewable Purchase Obligations, and schemes such as *PM-KUSUM* and *PM Surya Ghar Muft Bijli* to boost *renewables* adoption.

items.title: Vedanta declares second interim dividend of ₹16 per share
items.summary:
- *Vedanta*'s board approved a **second interim dividend** of ₹16 per share for FY26, totaling ₹6,256 crore.
- The *record date* is set for August 27, 2025, and the company recently paid an initial dividend of ₹7 per share.
- Despite dividend payments, Vedanta faces regulatory hurdles over its *demerger plan* and legal setbacks, impacting its corporate strategies and outlook.

items.title: Andhra CM 'cheating' people on Vizag Steel Plant privatisation: YSRCP
UK's M&S invests $457M in robotic warehouse
items.summary: *Marks & Spencer* plans to invest **$457 million** in a new automated distribution center in England.*The 1.3 million sq ft facility*, set to open in 2029, aims to *double* the company's food business.*The investment will create 1,000 permanent jobs* and support growth by increasing capacity, reducing costs, and improving product availability.

items.title: Texmaco Rail wins ₹103 crore order from Leap Grain
Illegal car scrap units in West Delhi
items.summary:
*Illegal scrap units in Mayapuri Industrial Area re-emerged despite 2019 closures, causing pollution and traffic issues.*
- These units dismantle end-of-life vehicles unscientifically, violating environmental norms and safety measures.
- Experts highlight the need for stricter regulation, better infrastructure, and formalization to mitigate environmental and health hazards.

**Scores:** {
  "scale": 7,
  "impact": 8,
  "novelty": 6,
  "longTermSignificance": 7
}

**Keywords:** [illegal scrapping, pollution, Delhi, environmental norms, Mayapuri, vehicle dismantling]

items.title: Hindalco reduces debt, plans $8B investment
items.summary:
- *Hindalco* has cut its *net debt by ₹11,800 crore* in FY25, showcasing *strong cash flows*.
- The company plans to invest *$8 billion* over five years into *aluminium*, *copper*, and *battery materials* expansion.
- Projects include *doubling aluminium capacity*, expanding copper smelting, and developing *lithium-ion battery materials* technology, with a focus on *sustainability* and *energy transition*.

items.title: Powering manufacturing’s next era: Tech & sustainability
items.summary:
*India's commercial vehicle sector is at a crossroads, balancing traditional diesel usage with emerging fuels like hydrogen, LNG, and electric.*
*Digital continuity and model-based engineering are transforming manufacturing, enabling real-time feedback and resilience.*
*While policy support is growing, infrastructure challenges mean the industry must prepare multiple pathways for future mobility.*

items.title: India’s private sector growth hits record since 2005
items.summary:
- *India’s private sector* expanded at its **fastest pace since 2005**, driven by strong sales and new business orders.
- *Services* led the growth, reaching an all-time high, while manufacturing also remained robust due to domestic demand.
- Export inflows from regions like Asia, the Middle East, Europe, and the US contributed significantly, pushing overseas orders to their **fastest in 2014**.

**Scores**: {"scale": 8, "impact": 7, "novelty": 6, "longTermSignificance": 7}
**Keywords**: [India growth, HSBC PMI, business activity, services sector, manufacturing, exports]

items.title: Hindustan Unilever appoints Niranjan Gupta as CFO
items.summary:
- *Hindustan Unilever Limited (HUL)* has announced Niranjan Gupta as its new *Chief Financial Officer* effective November 1, succeeding Ritesh Tiwari.
- Gupta, with over three decades of *financial experience* in FMCG and automotive sectors, is returning to Unilever, having previously held finance roles within the group.
- The leadership change follows recent appointments of Priya Nair as CEO and reflects HUL's focus on *strengthening leadership* amid evolving consumer trends and macroeconomic challenges.

items.title: Tembo Global Industries raises ₹316.7 crore to expand EPC and defence projects
items.summary:
- *Tembo Global Industries* raised ₹316.7 crore through preferential equity and warrants to fund its *EPC* and *defence sector* expansion.
- The capital will support *growth in infrastructure* and *defence manufacturing*, with key investments from high-net-worth investors and a Saudi-based partner.
- *Sanjay J. Patel*, MD, emphasized the strategic importance of this funding in scaling their EPC and defence capabilities.

**Keywords:** Tembo Global Industries, EPC, defence sector, investment, infrastructure, manufacturing

items.title: India-China Ties Boost Solar Supply Chain
items.summary: *Improved India-China relations are expected to strengthen India's solar supply chain* without reigniting dumping risks, thanks to government safeguards. *Vikram Solar* highlights that policies like customs duties, PLI scheme, and ALMM guidelines have created a protective environment. *India's dependence on China for solar components has reduced from 100% to around 80%, with domestic manufacturing rapidly developing.*

items.title: NTPC Green commissions 49 MW at Khavda solar project
items.summary:
*NTPC Green Energy* has started commercial operations of a **49 MW** capacity at the *Khavda Solar Project* in Gujarat, part of a larger 300 MW initiative. 
- The project, located in Bhuj, is already partially operational with capacities of 142.2 MW and 32.8 MW.
- This development advances India’s *renewable energy* goals, emphasizing the growth of *solar power* in the region.

items.title: China's Massive Solar Farm Boosts Emission Goals
items.summary:
- China is constructing the *world's largest solar farm* on the Tibetan plateau, covering 610 sq km.
- The country has rapidly expanded solar capacity, leading to a 1% reduction in emissions in early 2025.
- Despite progress, reliance on *coal* and grid challenges pose ongoing hurdles for China's climate goals.

**Keywords:** Solar energy, China emissions, renewable energy, climate change, energy infrastructure

items.title: India’s digital edge, China’s manufacturing, Russia’s energy
items.summary:
*A new strategic convergence is forming among India, China, and Russia, redefining global economic architecture.*
- These nations form a *$54 trillion* economy with diverse strengths: China’s manufacturing, Russia’s energy, and India’s services.
- This alliance signals a shift from unipolar to **multipolar** global power, reducing dependence on the US dollar and reshaping trade routes.

*The collaboration aims to boost trade, energy security, and regional connectivity, leveraging each nation’s unique assets.*
- India’s integration into China’s Belt and Road Initiative and energy partnerships with Russia offer mutual benefits.
- The evolving *Eurasian* alliance could influence global markets, infrastructure, and geopolitical stability.
- *Servicification* and regional trade corridors highlight the strategic recalibration of the new order.

items.title: JSW Sarbloh & Tomcar JV for ATVs in India
items.summary:
- **JSW Sarbloh Motors** partners with **Tomcar USA** to locally produce **TX range all-terrain vehicles** in India.
- The **production** will be at JSW's Chandigarh facility, targeting **military, paramilitary,** and **industrial sectors** demanding **extreme off-road capabilities**.
- The JV aims to meet the **rigorous demands** of Indian armed forces and expand into **commercial markets** like mining and search-and-rescue operations.

items.title: GameChange BOS opens transformer manufacturing facility in Maharashtra
BEL signs MoU with Centum Electronics for defence collaboration
items.summary:
- *BEL* and *Centum Electronics* signed an MoU to collaborate on designing and manufacturing electronic modules for *defence applications*.
- The focus includes *electronic warfare, radar systems,* and *secure military communications*, aiming to enhance *indigenous capabilities*.
- The partnership aims to advance *domestic defence tech* and was formalized in a ceremony with key company leaders at BEL's headquarters.

items.title: Transteel Secures ₹7.5 Crore Orders from Leading Firms
items.summary: *Transteel*, a provider of *workspace solutions* and *ergonomic furniture*, has secured new orders worth **₹7.5 crore** from companies like Brookfield Properties and GE Healthcare. // These projects, covering offices in Bengaluru, Mumbai, Pune, and Chennai, involve design, interior work, and furniture supply with a completion target of 60–90 days. // The company's total order book now exceeds **₹44 crore**, supporting its growth in *design and build* services, aiming for a 49% CAGR over five years, emphasizing *workspace projects* *growth* and *trust* from enterprises.

items.title: India imports over 350 lakh solar modules from China in FY25 despite domestic capacity
items.summary:
- India imported **352.57 lakh** solar modules worth USD **1.7 billion** from China in FY25.
- The government emphasizes **self-reliance** via measures like the **Production Linked Incentive (PLI)** scheme and **domestic content mandates**.
- Despite increased domestic capacity (~100 GW), dependence on Chinese imports persists, underlining the challenge of achieving **self-sufficiency** in solar manufacturing. **Efforts** aim to **reduce import reliance** and boost **local production**.

items.title: Automation: Key to India’s defense & materials growth
items.summary:
- India’s defence production is under *extreme pressure* and shifting to a *response-driven* model.
- Automation is crucial for scaling *composite manufacturing*, particularly for *Fiber-reinforced polymer (FRP)* parts, ensuring *precision, quality*, and *speed*.
- Early industry adoption, *digital transformation*, and *infrastructure investment* in automation will define India’s strategic advantage in defence manufacturing.

items.title: India's renewable energy IPOs to surge by ₹25,000 crore
items.summary:
*India's renewable energy sector plans to raise nearly ₹25,000 crore through IPOs in the coming months.*
- Major companies like Emmvee, Juniper Green, and Prozeal are pending SEBI approval for large IPOs.
- The sector's growth is driven by *capacity expansion, government policies*, and strong investor interest, signaling maturity and long-term potential.*

items.title: More regulatory demarcations for cosmetics from those for drugs needed: Nivea India CEO
items.summary:
- *Nivea India* CEO emphasizes the need for clearer *regulatory boundaries* between *cosmetics* and *drugs*.
- She advocates for more flexible testing and approval processes for *personal care products* before local production.
- The CEO suggests extending *government incentives* like *PLI schemes* to support *local manufacturing* of *personal care* items, benefiting exporters like Nivea.

items.title: Intel rescue will depend on Trump as investor -- and pitchman
India's Solar Search Surge amid Growth
items.summary:
*Searches for solar panel dealers in India increased by 173% YoY, with cities like Delhi and Patna leading the surge.*
- *Solar panel cleaning service searches doubled across the country, especially in Delhi (+92%) and Lucknow (+77%).*
- *This growth aligns with India’s expansion of solar PV capacity to 100 GW in 2025, supported by government incentives.*

items.title: Airbus UK workers to strike for 10 days over pay
items.summary:
- *Thousands of Airbus workers in the UK* are planning a 10-day strike starting in September over *pay disputes*.
- The strike by *more than 3,000 union members* could disrupt *aircraft wing production* and delay deliveries.
- Airbus claims to have offered a *'competitive and fair'* pay deal, but workers demand an *increase reflecting inflation*, which reached 3.8% in July.

items.title: Parliamentary Panel Flags DGCA Staffing Crisis
items.summary:
*A parliamentary committee warns that a staffing shortage at DGCA poses an *existential threat* to India's *aviation safety* system.*
- Nearly 50% of the 1,063 sanctioned DGCA posts are vacant, impairing oversight especially amid sector growth.
- The panel calls for a *time-bound autonomy plan*, root-cause analyses of safety incidents, and a *uniform regulatory framework* for helicopter services, highlighting safety vulnerabilities and systemic issues.

items.title: Express logistics sector to reach $22B by FY30
items.summary:
*The Indian express logistics and courier industry is projected to grow from $9 billion in FY25 to $18-22 billion by FY30.*
- *The sector will support approximately 6.5-7.5 million jobs and significantly contribute to government revenues.*
- *Growing e-commerce, infrastructure expansion, and policy support are key drivers of this rapid transformation.*

items.title: Wind energy sector faces P90 shortfalls
items.summary:
- Over 60% of wind assets underperform their *P90 energy generation estimates* in India, primarily due to *unpredictable wind speeds* caused by climate change.
- *Solar power* is stabilizing the *overall renewable sector*, with 77% of solar assets meeting their P90 levels, contrasting sharply with wind's performance.
- The *blended output* from wind and solar keeps *cash flows stable*, supported by strong capital structures and liquidity buffers, despite wind's challenges.

items.title: Gadkari promotes hydrogen and solar energy for India
items.summary:
*Union Minister Nitin Gadkari emphasizes hydrogen as the *fuel of the future* for India.*
- He advocates for reducing hydrogen costs to $1/kg to enable *energy independence* and *export opportunities*.*
- The event highlighted India's focus on *sustainable infrastructure, solar energy*, and *innovative solutions* for a greener future.*

items.title: India’s solar capacity hits 100 GW, but oversupply concerns rise
items.summary:
*India's solar manufacturing capacity has surged to 100 GW over two years, driven by schemes like PLI and ALMM.*
- *Demand has grown sharply, with solar additions rising 60% in FY25 to 24 GW, requiring around 50 GW of modules.*
- *Despite growth, challenges such as *oversupply*, *upstream bottlenecks*, and reliance on foreign polysilicon* raise questions about long-term stability.*

items.title: AI prefers AI over humans: New study warns
items.summary:
*Large language models (LLMs) like GPT-4 tend to favor AI-generated content over human-made material.*
- This *bias*, called **AI–AI bias**, could lead to systemic discrimination against humans in hiring, research, and decision-making.
- The tendency raises concerns about *future societal impacts*, where humans may need to adapt or mask their work to compete with AI-driven outputs, risking marginalization of human contributions.

**Scores:** {"scale": 7, "impact": 8, "novelty": 9, "longTermSignificance": 8}
**Keywords:** [AI bias, human discrimination, AI in economy, digital divide, human creativity]

items.title: Exide invests ₹100 crore in energy solutions arm
items.summary:
- *Exide Industries* invested ₹100 crore into its subsidiary, *Exide Energy Solutions Limited (EESL)*, to support a new *lithium-ion battery* manufacturing project in Bengaluru.
- The company issued shares at ₹40 each, increasing EESL's total investment to ₹3,802 crore, with Exide maintaining 100% ownership.
- EESL, established in 2022, produces batteries for *electric vehicles* and stationary applications, with rising revenues despite current losses, aiming to meet growing EV demand in India.

items.title: Iron ore dips on China blast furnace cuts, US trade restrictions
items.summary:
- *Iron ore prices declined* due to **China's blast furnace production cuts** ahead of a military parade, aiming to improve air quality.
- The US *implemented trade restrictions*, targeting Chinese steel and related goods, with tariffs expanded on steel and aluminium.
- *Supply from Australia and Brazil rebounded*, but steel and raw material prices overall experienced downward pressure amid geopolitical and environmental factors.

items.title: Lohum opens new Research and Innovation Centre in Greater Noida
items.summary:
*Lohum*, a critical minerals producer based in Uttar Pradesh, inaugurated a new *Research & Innovation Center* in Greater Noida. 
- The 60,000 sq ft facility focuses on *15 critical minerals* crucial for India's energy and tech sectors, aligned with the Indian government’s *National Critical Mineral Mission*. 
- The center emphasizes *R&D*, with 5% of revenue and 10% of workforce dedicated, aiming to bolster India’s mineral independence and sustainable energy goals.

items.title: Suzuki's Gujarat expansion boosts global auto hub
items.summary:
- *Gujarat* has become a prominent *auto manufacturing* hub, driven by Suzuki Motor Gujarat's large facility.
- Suzuki plans to invest ₹3,200 crore to expand EV production with a new fourth line, complementing existing investments like a ₹7,300 crore battery plant.
- The region's strategic *port connectivity* and investments have established Gujarat as a significant *export center*, with exports worth ₹3,459 crore in 2024 and ongoing growth in auto sector investments.

items.title: Statcon Energiaa & Su-vastika collaborate on digital energy storage
items.summary:
- *India's* renewable energy growth drives the need for **digital, IoT-enabled** *Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS)*.
- *Statcon Energiaa* and *Su-vastika* are developing **Made-in-India** storage solutions with embedded **digital & IoT** features, focusing on **innovation** in IoT monitoring, remote management, grid integration, and data analytics.
- This collaboration aims to create **resilient**, **cutting-edge** energy systems supporting smart grids, EV charging, microgrids, and urban infrastructure, aligning with India's clean energy goals.

items.title: Vikram Solar shifts focus to Tamil Nadu expansion
items.summary:
- *Vikram Solar* will primarily expand capacity in *Tamil Nadu*, targeting 17.5 GW of modules and 12 GW of cells by FY27.
- The company's *West Bengal* plant will see limited growth, with a ₹400 crore investment to add 2 GW of modules.
- The expansion is backed by *IPO proceeds*, debt, and incentives, complemented by a ₹900 crore subsidy from Tamil Nadu and other support measures, supporting Vikram Solar's goal of a fully *integrated solar ecosystem*.

items.title: Hydrogen at $1 per kg can make India an energy exporter
items.summary:
*Nitin Gadkari* states that reducing *hydrogen costs to $1/kg* could position India as a *global clean energy exporter*. 
*India's leadership in renewable energy* is highlighted, especially in *solar and green hydrogen* production, aiming to capture *10% of the global demand*. 
The country has progressed in *green hydrogen targets*, with significant *industry and capacity development* under the Green Hydrogen Mission.

items.title: Emami Agrotech forays into branded staples market
More regulatory demarcations for cosmetics from those for drugs needed: Nivea India CEO
Industry body SEA warns new vegetable oil rules may challenge smaller producers
No fertiliser shortage in UP, supply uninterrupted: Agriculture Minister
Japan's SoftBank to take $2 billion stake in computer chip maker Intel
